Epidemiology

Epidemiology Research

Investigating disease patterns and developing evidence-based interventions for population health

Research Focus

Investigating the distribution and determinants of health-related states in populations, and applying this knowledge to control health problems through rigorous epidemiological methods and causal inference approaches.

Infectious Disease Epidemiology

Disease transmission dynamics, outbreak investigation, and evaluation of prevention and control measures for infectious diseases in diverse populations and settings.

Disease Surveillance Outbreak Analysis TB & HIV

Environmental Epidemiology

Health impacts of environmental exposures including household air pollution, water quality, and climate-related health risks in resource-limited settings.

Air Pollution Climate Health Exposure Assessment

Maternal & Child Health

Epidemiological research on neonatal mortality, childhood nutrition, and maternal health outcomes with focus on low- and middle-income countries.

Neonatal Mortality Child Nutrition LMIC

Cancer Epidemiology

Investigation of cancer incidence, survival, and risk factors in Sub-Saharan Africa, including pediatric oncology and population-based cancer registries.

Cancer Survival Pediatric Cancer Risk Factors

Chronic Disease Epidemiology

Study of cardiovascular disease, diabetes, and other non-communicable diseases, focusing on modifiable risk factors and prevention strategies.

CVD Diabetes Prevention

Health Systems Research

Evaluation of health service delivery, quality of care, and implementation of evidence-based interventions in healthcare systems.

Quality of Care Implementation Health Services

Methodological Expertise

Study Design

Cohort studies, case-control studies, cross-sectional surveys, and randomized trials with expertise in design optimization for observational research.

Causal Inference

Directed acyclic graphs (DAGs), propensity score methods, instrumental variables, and advanced techniques for establishing causality from observational data.

Spatial Epidemiology

Geographic information systems (GIS), spatial clustering analysis, and disease mapping for understanding spatial patterns of health outcomes.

Key Research Contributions

Published research addressing critical public health challenges

Household Air Pollution & Respiratory Infections

Systematic review of household air pollution and acute lower respiratory infections in adults, informing WHO guidelines and public health interventions. Cited by 54.

View on Google Scholar →

Cancer Survival in Malawi

Retrospective cohort study documenting cancer presentation and outcomes in resource-limited settings, contributing to understanding of cancer burden in Sub-Saharan Africa. Cited by 32.

Neonatal Mortality Determinants

Spatiotemporal analysis of neonatal mortality in Malawi using NEST360° baseline data, identifying key risk factors and geographic patterns for targeted interventions.

Pediatric Oncology Outcomes

Multiple studies on childhood cancer outcomes, malnutrition, and quality of life in Sub-Saharan Africa, advancing understanding of treatment challenges in resource-limited settings.

Collaborative Research

WHO Collaborations

Systematic reviews and meta-analyses informing WHO guideline development for acute malnutrition management and maternal-child health interventions.

Multi-Country Studies

Participation in international research collaborations across Sub-Saharan Africa, contributing to global health knowledge and policy.

Implementation Science

Research-to-practice translation working with AMREF, UNICEF, World Bank, and national health ministries to implement evidence-based interventions.

Research Collaboration

Interested in collaborative epidemiological research or consulting on study design and analysis?
